title: @RiotRepertoir Leblanc in her current state
body:
http://champion.gg/champion/Leblanc

I know here is an assasin circlejerk and this thread will get downvoted from salty bronze people who still think leblanc is "broken OP LELELE xDXDXD" but I wanted to ask riot for their opinion on leblancs current state.
So we can see that leblanc currently is at 43.8% winrate.
Her playrate went down from 10% to 4%.
And her winrate NEVER ever hits 50% even from mains who have 125+ games on her.
Can we admit that riot overnerfed her? Like this statistics talk for themself.
I know her laning is frustrating and everything and everybody hates it when leblanc is fotm but she IS in need of change.
She is horrible right now, like REALLY horrible.
Champions like ahri with 54% winrate while having a casual playerbase  ( http://champion.gg/champion/Ahri for reference) are considered balanced but leblanc needs to stay in her current state? 
I kinda feel that riot simply overnerfed leblanc because of the gigantic circlejerk about her and I wanted to remind riot that they did a mistake balancewise with her.
.....
I hate leblanc like everyone else but I dont think her team should suffer from her pick as much as it does right now.
Currently if you want to lose a game activly in champ select you pick leblanc, that just feels a bit unfair for the playerbase that enjoys that champion.
I suggest buffing her lategame/midgame teamfighting somehow and it would be great if riot wouldnt give her more power in laning to prevent her from being a very very frustrating lane opponent.
....
And everybody who thinks that winrate doesnt matter, hitting nearly 40% winrate with 0 pickrate speaks for itself.
@RiotRepertoir
@Meddler

replies.body:
She may have been overnerfed, and I believe there are W speed adjustments in on 5.16 PBE at the moment.

That said, she historically falls into that Azir, Ryze, Kassadin, etc. category of champions that is balanced for higher levels of play when their solo queue win rate is in the ~45% range. This isn't to say that any of these champions _must_ be weak; it's more that their performance dramatically increases with skill level and/or player experience, to the point that if they were balanced around a 50% win rate for all players, they would be 56/57%+ for experienced/skilled players. Most recently, we saw this on Ryze, whose experienced win rate jumped up above 60% by some measure despite being ~50% in solo queue at average elos.

Has the rework been iceboxed?  I just don't see a way to balance LeBlanc with her current kit, despite getting rid of the silence.  With her power curve, her utility, and her level of safety, she's always going to roflstomp or get roflstomped.  I don't particularly mind feast or famine assassins, but LeBlanc just feels extremely shitty to play against.  And I'm afraid once that speed gets upped even by the slightest, she'll go back to making me avoid mid lane like the plague.
There's currently no rework planned that I know of.

Not the response I wanted to hear lol.  In that case I really want you guys to think long and hard about potential buffs to LeBlanc, because I think that any buffs on her is going to turn her into Elise 2.0, and she'll be permabanned until she's back in this position again.

I'd say if she isn't considered for being rework, that you should really look into it, because as it stands she's either going to be completely useless, or the most toxic champion to face in the game.   I don't just say that every champion needs a rework if they're overtuned, but with LeBlanc's power curve, safety, and utilty, I really don't see how number changes alone could put her in the Goldilocks spot of "not too OP, not too UP, but juuuust right."

Edit:  But you seem like you know what you're doing, so I'm open to ideas.

Might be time to put her toward the top of the list. She's frustrating to play as (unless you ROFL stomp in 20 minutes) and against. She's extremely difficult to balance, and her kit has very limited counter-play. She has a lot of potential to be super cool if you embrace her "mirror" mage identity, rather than her burst you to fucking death in 2 seconds or less identity.

I'm a long time LeBlanc player and I recall before the small rework buff (when she got fotm.) everyone just said "Oh she does a ton of damage but her CS sucks and shes too risky late game."

That was with silence, "full movement speed distortion," and roughly the same burst output.

I think her identity was best kept as a zero counter play poke champion. However, with the option to do 2 Ethereal Chains or 2 Distortions, it makes her incredibly safe providing she didn't blow her ult on a botched assassination.

I think if they restore her mobility and consider a short silence, they can look at nerfing her root tether's cc. A lot of her escapes and team play involve rooting people forever, but people get so caught up about a 17/0 LeBlanc bursting them that it often gets left out of discussions.

---
Edit: I was taking a crap and had a good idea for a rework;
--
_What if we port everything people hate about LeBlanc onto her ult and nerf her primary abilities?_

Sigil of Malice: Reduced damage on consuming it
Distortion: Slower dash
Ethereal Chains: No root

Mimic: Sigil of Malice: Silences the enemy for 1 second, more damage.
Mimic: Distortion: Blinks to enemy
Mimic: Ethereal Chains: Roots enemy 

Just a interesting thought, didn't really think too deep into balance. Many of the "toxic" components left from her rework were because any combinations of her abilites blew you up without her losing any form of CC/mobility.

Honestly, my biggest issue with LeBitch has always been that she can 100/0 pretty much any champ at level 3, so moving her power later in the game is something I wouldn't argue against.  I also really wouldn't mind having her old "toxic" abilities ported onto her ultimate, of course, the cooldown would have to be adjusted to fit that.  

I also think that with her current abilities, she'll be designated as the carry buster, much like Shaco, but moving the power away from her early game will hurt her overall power because early game was where she was best at, and much like Pantheon her kit is really bad for late game engages.  You'd have to do some serious numbers magic to get this work, but all in all a solid idea.

Well historically leblanc always is nerfed within seasons and make a godly rise when the seasons start crushing newbies.

Honestly, when I look at a champion like LeBlanc I have a habit of comparing her to other champions that have somewhat similar mechanics/abilities. Take her W for example, why is it fair that LeBlanc gets two dashes that she has ample time to be able to swap back to either of them and has no delay before she can instantly warp back, when {{champion:238}}'s most recent nerf made it so he has to wait a second before he can swap back? Especially since after Zed ults, you immediately know when and where he is going to reappear and where he is going to swap back to (assuming you had vision of him before he ulted). Or how about how she has the ability to chain and root 2 enemies at once, yet her chain has double the range that {{champion:43}}'s does before it breaks.

When they made that change to Zed, it felt like they were addressing the issue with that particular type of mechanic, and LeBlanc always seems to be the exception to that rule.

Now I know you can make arguments about how certain mechanics are more powerful on some kits then others, but her particular mechanics are what makes LeBlanc so frustrating. "But she can delete me in like 2 seconds!" Big deal, so can most of the other assassins in the game. But when it gets to the point where she Distortions over a wall while being chased and ALMOST NEVER has to worry about her pursuer flashing after her because she can either swap back immediately or use her ult to distortion over a 2nd wall, then you start to realize how she gets away with shenanigans that MECHANICALLY have been very finely tuned on champions with only half of her power.

If she can get away with that much, there has to be some drawbacks somewhere. I'm not saying I want her gutted, just with more of an emphasis on counterplay around her.

Leblanc is the epitome of a gutted assassin.
